linkTarget.anchoringText: These major and well-known different units, prevent the conventional analysis of Voidage Replacement Ratio (VRR) as other conventional reservoirs (Figure 1). The initial completion design did not address the injection profile control and the majority of water was going to the unit UB5. The objective of using WFR is to improve the vertical sweep efficency by enabling the operator to maintain higher injection rates into layers less affected by waterflood induced problems.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Ghapical representation of the five major units.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Ghapical representation of the five major units.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Meanwhile, with the demand of pressure support and increasing number of producers, a new project in Upper Burgan for Effluent Water System has been started in 2014. Currently the injectors meet allowable that was specified based on simulation modeling target for Upper Burgan and it is approximately 100MBWPD. The current injection profile & liquid production trend in Upper Burgan are shown in Figure 2.

The basic principle of WFR is from old Watermann patent form the 50â€™s. One piston is moveable and the other one is fixed as shown in Figure 3 [RAJ11] with the size variable depending on the flow desired to be injected in that certain layer so the regulator is calibrated by predetermined flow rate.

Each layer or zone is packed off to prevent any fluids within that zone of the wellbore invading another zone. An injection nozzle is located within each section. Several companies currently sell these valves based on the same principle. Figure4 and 5 show some valves from one of these providers, normally the service include the valves and the tool for the instalation in the mandrel.

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Water Flooding Regulator valves and Kick over tools.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Water Flooding Regulator valves and Kick over tools.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Each layer or zone is packed off to prevent any fluids within that zone of the wellbore invading another zone. An injection nozzle is located within each section. Several companies currently sell these valves based on the same principle. Figure4 and 5 show some valves from one of these providers, normally the service include the valves and the tool for the instalation in the mandrel.

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: Water Flooding Regulator valves. Some models.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Water Flooding Regulator valves. Some models.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Packer to packer minimum length 12 ft (no pup joints included), and preferable more than this when available

SA-M injector well is located on the west south part of SA field as shown in Figure 7. It was completed in 2014 with conventional one packer completion to inject into three reservoir layers. Initially, the well was perforated in UB-2, UB-4 and UB-5 but unfortunately, more than 95 % of the total injected water was being going into UB-5 based on ILT (Figure 8).

SA-M injector well is located on the west south part of SA field as shown in Figure 7. It was completed in 2014 with conventional one packer completion to inject into three reservoir layers. Initially, the well was perforated in UB-2, UB-4 and UB-5 but unfortunately, more than 95 % of the total injected water was being going into UB-5 based on ILT (Figure 8).

Step Rate Injectivity Test (SRIT) was done in two zones before installing the regulators. The aim of this test is to determine Formation Parting Pressure (FPP) so as to create fractures and channels prior to installing WFR valves. Figure 9 shows four plots, in the left side, the pressure and rate for the pump and in the right side the well-known SRIT plot for each layer.

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: Analysis of SRIT performed. Zone 1 Zone 2

formatted-caption.caption-text: Analysis of SRIT performed. Zone 1 Zone 2

linkTarget.anchoringText: The first implementation of WFR in Kuwait has proved the concept of improving vertical injection profile by enabling higher injection rates into layers that never received water before and regulating the distribution into all layers. As most of the water injected into the well (more than 90%) was traversing through one zone only before the job, the vertical distribution of injected water due to WFR approach resulted in choking the flow through this layer to about 60% and improve the flow through the remaining uncontacted layers like summirized in Table 1 and Figure 10.

image-wrap.label: Figure 10
image-wrap.caption: First ILT job done after water injection stabilization.

formatted-caption.caption-text: First ILT job done after water injection stabilization.

linkTarget.anchoringText: In addition to that, monitoring the pump intake preussure as shown in Figure 11 was very important to see if reservoir pressure will increase in the offset producers. Some of the offset producers are likely to take more time for getting benefit due to WFR, as there was injector Shut down for RWO & rigless operation for almost 2 months.

After two months of installation, a High Precision Temperature â€“ Spectral Noise Logging ((HPT â€“ SNL) was performed to confirm if the injection profile was improved and to know in more detail, how much water was received by each layer in Zone 1 where we placed three layers together. The results are shown in Figure 12.

image-wrap.label: Figure 12
image-wrap.caption: Second ILT and SNL was done after 2 months of installation.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Second ILT and SNL was done after 2 months of installation.
